comment._content: Possibly June 2, 1915: James Purcell, the one time gambling partner of the murdered Herman Rosenthal, who is in the death house in Sing Sing Prison, awaiting execution for the ... select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0E17F7385C1373...

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: James Purcell, the gambler, shot his daughter in a quarrel with his wife on February 14, 1913. He had testified before the aldermanic committee that he had paid police graft before. Photos of him are in The Salt Lake tribune., February 15, 1913, Image 1 The sun., February 08, 1913, Image 2 New-York tribune., February 08, 1913, Page 3 According to the NYT, June 22, 1915, Governor Whitman issued an order removing him to the Dannemora State Hospital for Insane Convicts. But I'm not convinced that it's this man.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: There was a James Purcell of the United States Commission of Conciliation, mentioned in NYT, December 24, 1920 (at the end of article) NYT, June 21, 1918 (at the end of article)

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: If it's the convict, he was still alive in 1939, trying to convince a court that he was sane, and could hence be executed: news2.nnyln.net/plattsburgh-daily-press/plattsburgh-daily...
